Name: Kiritapu Allan
Description: Kiri Allan is a staunch advocate for the East Coast region and is committed to shaping New Zealand as a place where everyone can live and thrive.

Name: Ginny Andersen
Description: Ginny is a longstanding member of the Labour Party, joining in 2004, and serving as the Party Vice President from 2015-2017.

Name: Chris Ballie
Description: Before entering Parliament, Chris worked for 22-years as a teacher with students who have special learning needs, he trained as an English and Music teacher.

Name: Andew Bayly
Description: National is focused on supporting Port Waikato and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Camilla Belich
Description: I stood for Parliament because we have more work to do to build a fairer, kinder, more equal New Zealand for our children and grandchildren.

Name: David Bennett
Description: National is focused on supporting Hamilton and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Glen Bennett
Description: I'm committed to a nation that cares deeply for our people, as well as our planet, and Labour has strongly demonstrated its focus on both.

Name: Chris Bishop
Description: Getting things done for the Hutt is my top priority.

Name: Rachel Boyack
Description: I want Nelson to be a place of opportunity so that our young people can see a future in the region for them and their families.

Name: Rachel Brooking
Description: I’m proud of the Labour-led Government’s strong, responsive, open, and iterative approach to COVID-19. My focus is on positive action on climate change that is adaptive, evidence based, and community focussed

Name: Chris Hipkins
Description: No matter who you are or where you come from, everyone deserves the opportunity to fulfil their potential and live life to the fullest. We all have a responsibility to ensure nobody gets held back because of circumstances beyond their control.

Name: Simeon Brown
Description: I recently launched a petition calling on Auckland Transport to restore the speed limits on our local roads to their previous limits and stop trying to slow Auckland down

Name: Gerry Brownly
Description: National is focused on supporting Ilam and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Mark Cameron
Description: Mark is the authentic voice of rural New Zealand. Mark is a dairy farmer from Ruawai, Northland. He's lived and farmed around the Northland region for 30-years. He has a partner, and three children.

Name: Naisi Chen
Description: I believe New Zealand’s diverse community is critical in shaping our future. I’m proud of the work our Government is doing to support all Kiwis, so Aotearoa can enjoy economic and social growth.

Name: Karen Chhour
Description: Nearly every MP says they want to reform CYFPs/CYFs/Oranga Tamariki. Karen lived it and came to Parliament to make a better world for children. Her own story of overcoming adversity to have a loved family of her own and a successful business is the embodiment of ACT values. She changed her future.

Name: David Clark
Description: Hon Dr David Clark is the Labour Member of Parliament for Dunedin. He came to Parliament in 2011 via a circuitous route – having run a University of Otago residential college, worked as a Presbyterian Minister, and worked as a Treasury analyst. David has held a number of ministerial portfolios, including Commerce & Consumer Affairs, the Digital Economy & Communications, and State Owned Enterprises.

Name: Tamati Coffey
Description: We must constantly be asking ourselves; what more can we do, to allow Māori to realise their rangatiratanga?

Name: Judith Collins
Description: We should all be proud of our collective response to COVID-19 and my absolute focus as MP for Papakura will be our economic recovery.We will save jobs, we will get the economy growing again and we will do so by leveraging our country’s great strengths: our people, our communities, our great natural resources and our values of hard work, tenacity, innovation and aspiration.I'm about ideas that get results.

Name: Simon Court
Description: Simon is a Civil and Environmental Engineer with 23-years’ experience in roles for the private sector and local government. This includes 10-years leading engineering, planning, tendering, and construction teams primarily in Auckland, Wellington, and Fiji.

Name: Liz Craig
Description: I believe every child should have the best possible start in life and that the Government has an active role to play in protecting the environment and ensuring everyone can access the services they need.

Name: Marama Davidson
Description: I am enthusiastic and excited about making change that honours our connection to each other, and our planet.

Name: Kelvin Davis
Description: The future prosperity of our country requires us to make brave and bold decisions today.

Name: Jacqui Dean
Description: National is focused on supporting Waitaki and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Matt Doocey
Description: As MP for Waimakariri, I’m always looking at ways to support residents, have their voices heard and help facilitate positive outcomes. It’s important that I am across the views of Waimakariri constituents so I can accurately represent them in Parliament.

Name: Paul Eagle
Description: I want every child in Aotearoa New Zealand to grow up in a safe, healthy, caring country. I’m committed to reforming adoption legislation to ensure it connects children to their past while helping support their future wellbeing.

Name: Barbara Edmonds
Description: Fa'afetai tele lava to the people of Mana for entrusting me with your voice. I will work hard to make Mana the best place to live, work, go to school, and raise a family.

Name: Julie Anne Genter
Description: Julie Anne is working for more sustainable and just communities, and advocates for infrastructure that delivers for our people and protects the climate.

Name: Golriz Ghahraman
Description: Golriz is an Iranian-Kiwi refugee and made history as the first ever refugee to be sworn in as an MP, having arrived in Aotearoa as a child asylum seeker with her family from Iran.

Name: Paul Goldsmith
Description: National is focused on supporting Epsom and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Nicola Grigg
Description: National is focused on supporting Selwyn and your livelihood, from backing Kiwis who have lost their jobs and are looking to start their own business, to backing existing businesses to take on another employee.

Name: Shanan Halbert
Description: It’s a privilege everyday to be a strong local voice within Government for the people of Birkenhead, Northcote, Glenfield, Beach Haven, Birkdale and Hillcrest focusing on the issues that matter for our community.

Name: Peeni Henare
Description: We have come too far not to go further, we have done too much not to do more

Name: Emily Henderson
Description: Whangārei has massive potential. A stunning environment, innovative industries and a well-located port with the easiest access for overseas trading partners.

Name: Harete Hipango
Description: National List MP Harete Hipango has been selected as National’s candidate in Te Tai Hauāuru – the party’s first candidate in a Māori seat since 2002.
